that explains the sharp stabby pain in those bits
but i'm on the pill for that
and having some other shit for pancreatic messyness
but it aint all right either
summary: so, i wanna catch up on critical role but i am super busy lately cause exams y’know. and this thing called anxiety and...
body:
so, i wanna catch up on critical role but i am super busy lately cause exams y’know. and this thing called anxiety and depression that still plague me. don’t worry i’m taking my meds regularly, and they help (ie, i don’t feel like punching trough walls when math ain’t going well anymore) but damn. i still feel like screaming into the void. and if i watch cr, i will become an unproductive mess.  

so i am exercising a lot of self-control by not laying in bed all day binging cr and la by night. yay me.

summary: I made a thing for Critmas, a timeline for Critical Role Land in 2018. Use imgur link if too small https://imgur.com/b3RPp5v I...
caption:
I made a thing for Critmas, a timeline for Critical Role Land in 2018. Use imgur link if too small https://imgur.com/b3RPp5v

I dedicate this fan work/scribbling to:

@sockablock for being my first critter friend (I guess we are when Im comfortable enough to tag you?????) 

delsinfire, angel-ascending, sketchingsparrow, bboiseux, triaelf9, luckthebard

Every one of you talented people inspire me and give me literal life.

Yay 2019?

blog.name: nelsynoo
blog.title: Once More Unto the Breach
blog.description:
29 year old with a penchant for baking, shopping and broadway musicals. I have both a Masters Degree in War and an alarmingly extensive Disney collection.

I like to read, go rock-climbing, peruse art galleries and play Bioware games over and over while making the same choices each time.

summary: My first fanart from Campaign 2 of Critical Role is a Christmas card for @jadesabre301 She told me of her undying love for...
caption:
My first fanart from Campaign 2 of Critical Role is a Christmas card for @jadesabre301

She told me of her undying love for Widojest before I’d even started Campaign 2 which meant she’d brainwashed me!! Now I can’t help but see any interaction between Caleb and Jester as utterly adorable!

Anyhoo - here’s Jester and Caleb exchanging a Christmas present! (I’m not sure who is giving it to whom… I’ll leave it to you to decide :P )

summary: DONE IN THE DARK // 8tracks deep when the river’s high ; the dead south || bad seed sown ; the bellfuries || g-d’s gonna cut you...
caption:
DONE IN THE DARK // 8tracks

deep when the river’s high ; the dead south || bad seed sown ; the bellfuries || g-d’s gonna cut you down ; johnny cash || leave me alone ; chappaquiddick skyline || achilles ; the dead south || come into the water ; mitski || sea shanty ; quasi || ocean breathes salty ; modest mouse || when the ship comes in ; bob dylan || honey you ; the dead south

good news, guys, i have a lot of thoughts about fjord and i don’t know how to shut up 

deep when the river’s high ; the dead south

  • chest is heavy with all your doubt / children run and they scream they shout and / we run, we run, oh down south / never look into those eyes of satan’s wealth / … / your heart is lonely, but you don’t care || “this does not really fall in with keeping a low profile. we talked about this.”
    • a spooky country song. the Vibes. whenever fjord gets shady, he seems vaguely aware he’s done something wrong, but he’s also pretty good at pushing past those feelings. he’s got a unique talent for turning his head away from the darkness while still fully participating.

bad seed sown ; the bellfuries

  • some years ago / a hex was thrown / dark times, crooked lines, bleak tones, skulls and bones / i’m a bad seed sown || “a reward for this? i’m listening.”
    • watching. potential. learn. grow. provoke. consume. reward. patience. good.

g-d’s gonna cut you down ; johnny cash

  • what’s done in the dark will be brought to the light || “do you think that if we find him, you’ll stop talking like him?”
    • i love you, fjord. my sweet, shady warlock. i’m fascinated by the phrase long-tongued liar used in the refrain of this song. fjord is so, so good at blending in, at disguisting himself, at charming his way in and out of situations. it’s a very unique form of lying. there’s so much he keeps hidden from the world.

leave me alone ; chappaquiddick skyline

  • a hundred years ago a sailor / trod this ground i stood upon / take me away everyone / when he looks down || [vandren] was very good to me, when a lot of people in my life haven’t been.”
    • i see fjord as a very lonely character, particularly at the beginning of the campaign. if you’re a half-orc, no matter how charming you are, no matter how much you disguise yourself, you will still be unwelcome in a good amount of places. no matter how well fjord meshes with the mighty nein, i think there’s some deep loneliness he’ll always carry within himself.

achilles ; the dead south

  • i am a rhythm, i am a beat / i am that curse walking down the street / i am a cheat, i am a liar / i am no one’s desire / and when the time calls upon me, i will know where to go || “you ever have that dream where you look in the water and you see another face looking back at you, like you’re someone else?”
    • so like, you know when you grow up lonely? like, when you’re the only half-orc in your orphanage? and you’re the world’s easiest target even when you file your tusks and bite your tongue? and then, years later, you get a taste of power, and it’s so much better than what you used to be—what you still are; you still hate what you are—and it’s so worth it, to not be weak anymore, that you’re do anything to keep grasping at that power?

come into the water ; mitski

  • come into the water / do you want to be my baby? / are you waiting to touch me? / you look so good, but i keep my hands / ’til you come into the water || “perhaps it was destiny.” “perhaps it was.”
    •  can’t place it, but there’s something deeply unsettling about this song, which is why i chose it for avantika and fjord’s short relationship. i don’t think fjord was fully there for their interactions; i think he’s pretty good at deciding he’ll “keep her busy” and shutting out any fear and discomfort. yet despite all this disconnect, they do share this deep connection, maybe closer than either of them have ever been with anybody. uk’otoa connects them, and i don’t think fjord will be able to let go of their “relationship” easily.

sea shanty ; quasi

  • the captain was rightly murdered by the crew / but now they don’t know what to do || “you’re the captain. captain fjord!” “…captain…captain tusktooth.“
    • okay. well. this one is kind of on-the-nose, but i think it’s representative of fjord’s uncertainty at the current moment. captain avantika—a woman he had conflicting feelings about, to say the least—is dead. now he’s the captain of a dead woman’s ship, and while it’s obviously great to be rid of that threat, i don’t think fjord is quite comfortable in this position? but he can’t be uncomfortable, because he needs to be there for his crew? it’s a very anxiety-producing situation

ocean breathes salty ; modest mouse

  • your body may be gone, i’m gonna carry you in / in my head, in my heart, in my soul || “i expect better of myself. i let you guys down, i let jester down, i let yasha down. i’ll never be able to shake this.”
    • fjord shoulders the weight of those who have died. vandren dies? okay, so he’ll make vandren proud, no matter what—maybe he’ll appease an ancient sea god along the way. molly dies? okay, it must have been his fault; he wasn’t strong enough, wasn’t smart enough. avantika dies? okay, she was a pretty bad person, but maybe it was his fault because he slept with her? there’s no point in dwelling on the past, but fjord is pretty good at it.

when the ship comes in ; bob dylan

  • and the ship’s wise men / will remind you once again / that the whole wide world is watching || “my whole life was trying to blend in, trying to keep an eye out for someone that was looking to take advantage, that was going to exploit. i got comfortable. i felt relaxed.”
    • there’s a point when fjord realizes he can’t blend in any longer. there’s a point when he realizes he’s part of something greater than himself. and he’s not quite ready to take on that role yet, but somehow, he’s found himself in a position of leadership, and the world is watching, and fuck it, he’s doing the best he can.

honey you ; the dead south

  • honey you are a rock and i am your land and we will grow / before the sun dries us up and turns us to sand / do you remember when the ocean went mad / and we were to blame? / we ran to another world with lives to save ||  "are you worried about where we’re going?” “no. no, i’m more anxious to get there. my curiosity, i suppose, overrides my fear.”
    • a love song? maybe? choose your ship, if that’s what you’re into. i chose this song more as a song about the mighty nein. what a weird, errant group of disasters. maybe sometimes they wake an undead sea hag, but they’re trying their best. anyway, did you guys know that i’d lay down my life for fjord?

  • i am a rhythm, i am a beat / i am that curse walking down the street / i am a cheat, i am a liar / i am no one’s desire / and when the time calls upon me, i will know where to go || “you ever have that dream where you look in the water and you see another face looking back at you, like you’re someone else?”
    • so like, you know when you grow up lonely? like, when you’re the only half-orc in your orphanage? and you’re the world’s easiest target even when you file your tusks and bite your tongue? and then, years later, you get a taste of power, and it’s so much better than what you used to be—what you still are; you still hate what you are—and it’s so worth it, to not be weak anymore, that you’re do anything to keep grasping at that power?

come into the water ; mitski

  • come into the water / do you want to be my baby? / are you waiting to touch me? / you look so good, but i keep my hands / ’til you come into the water || “perhaps it was destiny.” “perhaps it was.”
    •  can’t place it, but there’s something deeply unsettling about this song, which is why i chose it for avantika and fjord’s short relationship. i don’t think fjord was fully there for their interactions; i think he’s pretty good at deciding he’ll “keep her busy” and shutting out any fear and discomfort. yet despite all this disconnect, they do share this deep connection, maybe closer than either of them have ever been with anybody. uk’otoa connects them, and i don’t think fjord will be able to let go of their “relationship” easily.

sea shanty ; quasi

  • the captain was rightly murdered by the crew / but now they don’t know what to do || “you’re the captain. captain fjord!” “…captain…captain tusktooth.“
    • okay. well. this one is kind of on-the-nose, but i think it’s representative of fjord’s uncertainty at the current moment. captain avantika—a woman he had conflicting feelings about, to say the least—is dead. now he’s the captain of a dead woman’s ship, and while it’s obviously great to be rid of that threat, i don’t think fjord is quite comfortable in this position? but he can’t be uncomfortable, because he needs to be there for his crew? it’s a very anxiety-producing situation

ocean breathes salty ; modest mouse

  • your body may be gone, i’m gonna carry you in / in my head, in my heart, in my soul || “i expect better of myself. i let you guys down, i let jester down, i let yasha down. i’ll never be able to shake this.”
    • fjord shoulders the weight of those who have died. vandren dies? okay, so he’ll make vandren proud, no matter what—maybe he’ll appease an ancient sea god along the way. molly dies? okay, it must have been his fault; he wasn’t strong enough, wasn’t smart enough. avantika dies? okay, she was a pretty bad person, but maybe it was his fault because he slept with her? there’s no point in dwelling on the past, but fjord is pretty good at it.

when the ship comes in ; bob dylan

  • and the ship’s wise men / will remind you once again / that the whole wide world is watching || “my whole life was trying to blend in, trying to keep an eye out for someone that was looking to take advantage, that was going to exploit. i got comfortable. i felt relaxed.”
    • there’s a point when fjord realizes he can’t blend in any longer. there’s a point when he realizes he’s part of something greater than himself. and he’s not quite ready to take on that role yet, but somehow, he’s found himself in a position of leadership, and the world is watching, and fuck it, he’s doing the best he can.

honey you ; the dead south

  • honey you are a rock and i am your land and we will grow / before the sun dries us up and turns us to sand / do you remember when the ocean went mad / and we were to blame? / we ran to another world with lives to save ||  "are you worried about where we’re going?” “no. no, i’m more anxious to get there. my curiosity, i suppose, overrides my fear.”
    • a love song? maybe? choose your ship, if that’s what you’re into. i chose this song more as a song about the mighty nein. what a weird, errant group of disasters. maybe sometimes they wake an undead sea hag, but they’re trying their best. anyway, did you guys know that i’d lay down my life for fjord?
trail.content:
DONE IN THE DARK // 8tracks

deep when the river’s high ; the dead south || bad seed sown ; the bellfuries || g-d’s gonna cut you down ; johnny cash || leave me alone ; chappaquiddick skyline || achilles ; the dead south || come into the water ; mitski || sea shanty ; quasi || ocean breathes salty ; modest mouse || when the ship comes in ; bob dylan || honey you ; the dead south

good news, guys, i have a lot of thoughts about fjord and i don’t know how to shut up 

deep when the river’s high ; the dead south

  • chest is heavy with all your doubt / children run and they scream they shout and / we run, we run, oh down south / never look into those eyes of satan’s wealth / … / your heart is lonely, but you don’t care || “this does not really fall in with keeping a low profile. we talked about this.”
    • a spooky country song. the Vibes. whenever fjord gets shady, he seems vaguely aware he’s done something wrong, but he’s also pretty good at pushing past those feelings. he’s got a unique talent for turning his head away from the darkness while still fully participating.

bad seed sown ; the bellfuries

  • some years ago / a hex was thrown / dark times, crooked lines, bleak tones, skulls and bones / i’m a bad seed sown || “a reward for this? i’m listening.”
    • watching. potential. learn. grow. provoke. consume. reward. patience. good.

g-d’s gonna cut you down ; johnny cash

  • what’s done in the dark will be brought to the light || “do you think that if we find him, you’ll stop talking like him?”
    • i love you, fjord. my sweet, shady warlock. i’m fascinated by the phrase long-tongued liar used in the refrain of this song. fjord is so, so good at blending in, at disguisting himself, at charming his way in and out of situations. it’s a very unique form of lying. there’s so much he keeps hidden from the world.

leave me alone ; chappaquiddick skyline

  • a hundred years ago a sailor / trod this ground i stood upon / take me away everyone / when he looks down || [vandren] was very good to me, when a lot of people in my life haven’t been.”
    • i see fjord as a very lonely character, particularly at the beginning of the campaign. if you’re a half-orc, no matter how charming you are, no matter how much you disguise yourself, you will still be unwelcome in a good amount of places. no matter how well fjord meshes with the mighty nein, i think there’s some deep loneliness he’ll always carry within himself.

achilles ; the dead south

  • i am a rhythm, i am a beat / i am that curse walking down the street / i am a cheat, i am a liar / i am no one’s desire / and when the time calls upon me, i will know where to go || “you ever have that dream where you look in the water and you see another face looking back at you, like you’re someone else?”
    • so like, you know when you grow up lonely? like, when you’re the only half-orc in your orphanage? and you’re the world’s easiest target even when you file your tusks and bite your tongue? and then, years later, you get a taste of power, and it’s so much better than what you used to be—what you still are; you still hate what you are—and it’s so worth it, to not be weak anymore, that you’re do anything to keep grasping at that power?

come into the water ; mitski

  • come into the water / do you want to be my baby? / are you waiting to touch me? / you look so good, but i keep my hands / ’til you come into the water || “perhaps it was destiny.” “perhaps it was.”
    •  can’t place it, but there’s something deeply unsettling about this song, which is why i chose it for avantika and fjord’s short relationship. i don’t think fjord was fully there for their interactions; i think he’s pretty good at deciding he’ll “keep her busy” and shutting out any fear and discomfort. yet despite all this disconnect, they do share this deep connection, maybe closer than either of them have ever been with anybody. uk’otoa connects them, and i don’t think fjord will be able to let go of their “relationship” easily.

sea shanty ; quasi

  • the captain was rightly murdered by the crew / but now they don’t know what to do || “you’re the captain. captain fjord!” “…captain…captain tusktooth.“
    • okay. well. this one is kind of on-the-nose, but i think it’s representative of fjord’s uncertainty at the current moment. captain avantika—a woman he had conflicting feelings about, to say the least—is dead. now he’s the captain of a dead woman’s ship, and while it’s obviously great to be rid of that threat, i don’t think fjord is quite comfortable in this position? but he can’t be uncomfortable, because he needs to be there for his crew? it’s a very anxiety-producing situation

ocean breathes salty ; modest mouse

  • your body may be gone, i’m gonna carry you in / in my head, in my heart, in my soul || “i expect better of myself. i let you guys down, i let jester down, i let yasha down. i’ll never be able to shake this.”
    • fjord shoulders the weight of those who have died. vandren dies? okay, so he’ll make vandren proud, no matter what—maybe he’ll appease an ancient sea god along the way. molly dies? okay, it must have been his fault; he wasn’t strong enough, wasn’t smart enough. avantika dies? okay, she was a pretty bad person, but maybe it was his fault because he slept with her? there’s no point in dwelling on the past, but fjord is pretty good at it.

when the ship comes in ; bob dylan

  • and the ship’s wise men / will remind you once again / that the whole wide world is watching || “my whole life was trying to blend in, trying to keep an eye out for someone that was looking to take advantage, that was going to exploit. i got comfortable. i felt relaxed.”
    • there’s a point when fjord realizes he can’t blend in any longer. there’s a point when he realizes he’s part of something greater than himself. and he’s not quite ready to take on that role yet, but somehow, he’s found himself in a position of leadership, and the world is watching, and fuck it, he’s doing the best he can.

honey you ; the dead south

  • honey you are a rock and i am your land and we will grow / before the sun dries us up and turns us to sand / do you remember when the ocean went mad / and we were to blame? / we ran to another world with lives to save ||  "are you worried about where we’re going?” “no. no, i’m more anxious to get there. my curiosity, i suppose, overrides my fear.”
    • a love song? maybe? choose your ship, if that’s what you’re into. i chose this song more as a song about the mighty nein. what a weird, errant group of disasters. maybe sometimes they wake an undead sea hag, but they’re trying their best. anyway, did you guys know that i’d lay down my life for fjord?

summary: All of Liam's oneshots have a similar energy as the John Dies at the End books; eldritch horror mixed with Hieronymus Bosch...
body: All of Liam’s oneshots have a similar energy as the John Dies at the End books; eldritch horror mixed with Hieronymus Bosch absurdity and juvinele humour. I’m 100% here for it.

Bixbi, older than you.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Possibly a lesser demon.

Hellenist serving Hestia, Hermes and Chiron.

Critical Role has taken over my life and my blog.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut
